references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of E(3)-equivariant neural networks, which are fundamental to the Wi-GATr architecture and its geometric inductive biases.
This paper introduces the GATr architecture, which forms the core of the Wi-GATr backbone and enables efficient processing of geometric algebra tokens.
This paper introduces the foundation of diffusion models, which are used in the probabilistic approach to wireless signal prediction and inverse problems.
This foundational transformer paper provides the basis for the GATr architecture which is used in Wi-GATr.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling through stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical framework for score-based generative models, which are employed to develop the probabilistic approach to wireless signal prediction.
